com.facebook.widget

Class FacebookDialog.MessageDialogBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.widget.FacebookDialog.MessageDialogBuilder
  • Enclosing class:
    FacebookDialog

    public static class FacebookDialog.MessageDialogBuilder
extends Object
    Provides a builder which can construct a FacebookDialog instance suitable for presenting the native Message dialog. This builder will throw an exception if the Facebook Messenger application is not installed, so it should only be used if FacebookDialog.canPresentMessageDialog(android.content.Context, com.facebook.widget.FacebookDialog.MessageDialogFeature...) indicates the capability is available. The "friends" and "place" properties will be ignored as the Facebook Messenger app does not support tagging.

        public CONCRETE setRequestCode(int requestCode)

        Parameters:
        requestCode - the request code
        Returns:
        this instance of the builder

      • setApplicationName

        public CONCRETE setApplicationName(String applicationName)
        Sets the name of the application to be displayed in the dialog. If provided, this optimizes the user experience as a preview of a shared item, etc., can be displayed sooner.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the name of the Facebook application
        Returns:
        this instance of the builder

      • setFragment

        public CONCRETE setFragment(Fragment fragment)
        Sets the fragment that should launch the dialog. This allows the dialog to be launched from a Fragment, and will allow the fragment to receive the onActivityResult call rather than the Activity.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment that contains this control

      • build

        public FacebookDialog build()
        Constructs a FacebookDialog with an Intent that is correctly populated to present the dialog within the Facebook application.
        Returns:
        a FacebookDialog instance

      • canPresent

        public boolean canPresent()
        Determines whether the native dialog can be presented (i.e., whether the required version of the Facebook application is installed on the device, and whether the installed version supports all of the parameters specified for the dialog).
        Returns:
        true if the dialog can be presented; false if not
